result.execSummary:
The defendant Jose Raul Galvan was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 9 years and 6 months bifurcated sentence.   AMENDED 06-01-2016:  CFTS = 0 days (credit previously granted was duplicate to credit received in 10CF1787)
Consecutive to: any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time employment, school or vocational training as determined by the agent.

Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may not have any alcohol in or on the premises of home.  Defendant may not go into any establishments that sell alcohol except for restaurants and grocery stores.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent, including alcohol and drug counseling, psychological and psychiatric treatment and counseling.  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.  Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  ***Defendant is eligible for SAP once 60% of the initial confinement time has been served.***

Atty Dirk Jensen
Preliminary hearing on July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant is ordered to have SCRAM unit installed and monitored by Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) - 524 S. Main Street, 3rd floor (262-632-1780.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail.  Do not drive at all.  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court and meeting w/his Atty.   Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Jose Raul Galvan in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Jose Raul Galvan in custody.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
